item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi! I am Bendit, Tsz Hin Chan (Chinese: 陳祉軒). I am from Hong Kong, currently a student of Mathematics in Imperial College London.

More about my course: Here.

Facts

  • I know $(4+\epsilon)$ languages: Cantonese, Mandarin, English, Korean and a little bit of French and Japanese.
  • I can play the piano and violin, but I listen to K-pop.
  • I enjoy puzzlehunts.
  • I like to produce music in my free time.
  • Eating and thinking about what to eat spans 70% of my time besides Mathematics.
  • I made some of the animations in The HoTT Game.

item.title: Notes
item.description:
Here are my non-exhaustive list of self-made notes. I never finished studying most of the topics, so the notes are incomplete. Also please forgive my typos.

Notes made during high-school

  • Local Fields (Jul 2017) – Incomplete notes during a study of local fields with my friend Mark Lau.

Notes made during university

  • Linear Algebra (finished; last update: 25 Mar 2022) – Notes of the course M40003 (Linear Algebra & Groups) in Imperial College London, following multiple sources.

  • Group Theory (active; last update: 10 Dec 2022) – Notes aiming to cover elementary group theory, following notes from multiple courses in Imperial College London and other books.

  • Algebraic Geometry – Ongoing notes of my first attempt at studying algebraic geometry.

    1. Part I: Varieties (active; last update: 25 Aug 2022), following Gathmann’s notes and Smith et al.’s book; created for my first-year UROP.
    2. Part II: Schemes (paused; last update: 2 Dec 2021), following Vakil’s and Hartshorne’s book.
